programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

Spy Pup is immersed in wild dog life to explore their maternal love, and Spy Penguin records the turbulent action of the mating season, as a male Adelie penguin falls victim to a pebble thief that ruins his chances of love for the season. Spy Tortoise and Spy Bushbaby keep watch on chimpanzees, while in perhaps the most moving scenes, Spy Monkey becomes the focus of attention for a troop of concerned langurs who believe the motionless camera-creature has died.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild

A boisterous elephant has a temper tantrum in the mud near the waterhole, chimpanzees have extra-marital affairs and lemurs get high by sniffing toxic millipedes.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh, in his capacity as Ranger of the Great Park, takes a tour of Windsor's grounds and points out the modifications he has made during his tenure, including a deer park and a farm shop selling local produce. He then competes in the Royal Horse Show, which also features Prince Harry. Meanwhile, the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall host a special banquet for the Prince's Trust.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.desc: Jonathan Ross tells the story of the comedy duo's attempts to become stars in America during the 1960s, via their appearances on The Ed Sullivan Show. programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston tells the story of Hitler's state executioner, who was placed in charge of killing thousands of people declared enemies of the state.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to examine more items brought in by viewers, beginning with a visit to Plas Newydd Country House and Gardens on Anglesey. Collectibles assessed include a Victorian cane carved with an image of the Menai suspension bridge, an 18th century grandmother clock, and two giant toy giraffes.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: This episode looks at life on the highest mountain range on Earth, the Himalayas, home to many extraordinary animals and remarkable ancient cultures. The programme follows snow leopards as they creep into isolated mountain villages searching for food, and monkeys huddling for warmth in a hidden, frozen forest, and the athletes who compete in the gruelling Everest marathon.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals' global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypus's breeding burrow.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

Cathy Sinclair, one of the beneficiaries of the bookie's will at his death, had a care-home upbringing in common with Soutar, but she claims to have no idea who he was or why she was left 15,000. McAndrew has a personal stake in the case - the original investigating officer was corrupt cop Frank McNair, who had an affair with his wife, and their paths soon cross. The London-based officers' questions begin to unsettle someone and a campaign of victimisation against them begins, but it's a revelation from McAndrew's girlfriend Charley that reawakens a long-dormant scandal and clears the path to a solution. programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul's god-daughter Amy arrives in Glenbogle intent on causing mischief, but he has precious little time for her as he deals with notorious poacher Tam's return to claim his mother's croft - and make trouble for the MacDonald family. Iona moves into the big house while her own is rebuilt, and Zoe's unimpressed by Ewan when he covers for Amy. Highland drama, with Lloyd Owen and Kellyanne Farquhar.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Heartbroken that Karen has left Skelthwaite to take care of her heroin-addicted son in London, a dejected David yearns to leave the village, taking Jess with him - but soon discovers his daughter has made a happy life with new boyfriend Joe. Meanwhile, Sally catches truant schoolboy Nathan in a compromising situation with Candida, and Anna fears for the health of elderly farm owner Essie Crayford. Rural drama, starring Philip Middlemiss, Kelly Wenham and Danny Seward.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon gets a passion for democracy - and decides to buy Darryl's vote from Tracey for the local by-election. Robert Llewellyn guests stars, with Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.sub-title: If You Go Down to the Woods
programme.desc: Marlene is distraught when Tyler and Earl the dog go missing. Boycie, Bryan and Jed form a search party, but hunting through the haunted woods at night proves a less than pleasant experience for the would-be rescuers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo hit on a solution to their transport problems - building their own bikes. Meanwhile, Sid and Ivy's cafe has been redecorated and is set for its grand re-opening. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank Hathaway finds an unlikely partner in Lu Shakespeare when the pair are thrown together to catch a killer and clear her name. Comedy drama about an oddball pair of private detectives who investigate crime in Stratford-upon-Avon, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate a skydiving accident and discover that someone had tampered with the victim's parachute. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate when the lifeless body of Gemma, a 17-year-old estate agent, is found in an empty house. Delving into the girl's family history, the forensic pathologist discovers she was thrown out of her home by her mother for having a child at the age of 13. Claims that Gemma was having an affair with her mother's second husband further complicates Sam's inquiries. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An operation to detain an aggressive and armed senile pensioner goes horribly wrong and Amanda Prosser makes Gina the scapegoat, forcing the Borough Commander to suspend her from duty while her drink problem is assessed. Detectives Nixon and Nadir get a lead on big-time gangster Pete Larson, but Dale Smith can't resist playing with fire by wooing the villain's lonely wife.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch members realise life must go on following Hallam's death when Nick tells them a new sub-officer has been appointed.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's prank calls to the other cab firm have gone too far this time. Arthur sets up meeting to get Ron his stall back and poor Geta thinks Sanjay's up to no good.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A patient's deathbed murder confession presents Dr Finlay with a crisis of conscience, over whether to keep a secret entrusted to him in strictest confidence or see to it that justice is done.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron and Dr Finlay are given a frosty reception when called in to investigate an outbreak of unusual symptoms among the nuns of a convent in the Tannochbrae area. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plots revenge, while Lovejoy and Lady Jane bicker over a royal dinner service belonging to a Belgian countess. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads move into a grim little hut on the Chocanaw reservation and set about rebuilding the bridge, but Barry begins to go off the rails as he remembers the good times with Tatiana. Work goes well thanks to help from Joe's son Chip - but Granger is livid to discover he has been made a fool of, and vows to have his revenge. Tim Healy and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A British detective turns up looking for Moxey, and a vengeful Grainger tries to prevent the lads completing their reconstruction of the bridge - but Oz lures the upper-crust crook to America, where he finally gets his comeuppance. Drama, starring Tim Healy, Timothy Spall, Kevin Whately, Christopher Fairbank and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The boss of Brokenwood agricultural show dies after a ride on the Ghost Train, and the investigation reveals his suspected heart attack was something far more sinister.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part Two
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy and Brackenreid goes after the corrupt copper.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Alex investigates a burglary and assault at the home of her future in-laws - a case that brings her face to face with 14-year-old Peter Drake, who will grow up to be her husband and Molly's father. Gene's initial lack of interest in the case ends when the fingerprints of a supposedly dead gangster are found at the scene, and he seizes the opportunity to get more positive headlines for the Met.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A murder victim is discovered in a canal, and Gene soon has his prime suspect when it turns out the dead man was mixed up with loan shark Trevor Riley. In their search for incriminating evidence, Gene and the team resort to breaking into Riley's office after hours - but what they find takes the case in a completely different direction. Guest starring Tom Georgeson and Daisy Haggard.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: James returns to his home town of Bolton to defend a couple living in a run-down flat who have been accused of murdering their baby daughter. However, conflicting testimony soon brings him up against his learned friend, Head of Chambers Peter Foxcott. Starring John Thaw, Oliver Ford Davies and Haydn Gwynne.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: First of two-part crime drama from the prolific pen of Lynda La Plante. DCI Roisin Connor is called in to investigate the gruesome discovery of a woman's severed hand in the River Thames, and soon finds herself pitted against rival officer Chief Superintendent Mike Walker as they are drawn into a deadly game with a psychotic killer. Victoria Smurfit and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: The Boys Are Back in Town
programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amanda Prosser steals all the credit for Gina's impressive initiative on antisocial behaviour, and teenage rapist Ross Trescot begs June to drop the charges against him, trying to excuse his actions by claiming to be a victim of sexual abuse. Roger finds himself attracted to a mugging victim's housemate, while Jo Masters and Suzie Sim present Neil with incriminating photographs of his father-in-law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil Manson clashes with his father-in-law when he learns the former Deputy Assistant Commissioner's involvement with underage boys has left him open to blackmail. Sam Nixon discovers the body of a missing Muslim estate agent and makes Phil Hunter jealous by arranging a date with the dead man's boss, while Gina's drinking leads to a complaint that could end her career. Andrew Lancel and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PCs Hemmingway and Bryant arrange a battle of the sexes against Roger Valentine and Dan Casper which boosts Sun Hill's clear-up rate at one stroke, but Gina's decision to celebrate their success in the pub while still on duty gives Amanda Prosser all the leverage she needs to get rid of the boozy Inspector. Ramani and Terry accept they will never be friends and Pippa Manson creates an embarrassing scene at the station when she learns Neil's investigations led to her father's death.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Drama set in 1895, chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. The first episode sees Eleanor embarking on her medical career _ and immediately crossing swords with eminent surgeon Sir Herbert Hamilton. Jemma Redgrave stars in the title role, with David Calder as her father, and Robert Hardy as Sir Herbert.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Round Tower
programme.desc: Feature-length drama set in the 1950s, starring Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman and his devoted wife, whose disenchantment with her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town. Keith Barron and Jan Harvey also star.

credits.actor: Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman
her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth finds out that Sarah is also in Sydney and arranges a meeting, Olivia and Carolyn make preparations for a card party for Sir Richard and George discovers who Anna's real father is.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah attends a back-street doctor, but cannot go through with the operation. Carolyn gets offered a job as art critic for one of Sir Richard's Sydney newspapers.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daddy has an accident while chasing a milkwoman on his bicycle, and ends up heavily sedated in hospital. First-ever episode of the suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and George Webb.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth invites the new vicar round for tea - but despite her meticulous planning, the afternoon does not go as planned. Sitcom about a super-snob intent on climbing the social ladder, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Jeremy Gittins.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth visits a stately home, where she naturally tries her hardest to meet the lord of the manor - only to be thwarted by the untimely arrival of Onslow and Daisy. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A distant cousin of Fred's who has Down's syndrome is taken in by the Buckles following the death of his protective mother, but Violet struggles to cope and Shelagh is forced to make other arrangements for his care. New recruit Valerie prepares for her first day at Nonnatus House, and Trixie comes to the aid of a pregnant woman who is in urgent need of dental treatment to avoid an infection. The nurses discover what has happened to Sister Mary Cynthia, a revelation that has distressing consequences for Sister Monica Joan.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: A mummified body is found bricked up in the basement of a suburban home, leading Harrow and Grace to investigate a crime from the past.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The discovery of a man's body in a disused mine shaft reawakens villagers' suspicions over a girl's death - and the mismatched duo's investigation lifts the lid on murder, mystery and intrigue. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives, with Polly Hemingway and Joe Duttine.

credits.actor: Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke and the team investigate university lecturer and crime novelist Mark Joffe, whose debut publication includes the detailed description of a murder identical to that of a real-life unsolved case. As the case unfolds, Burke becomes convinced of the writer's guilt, but cannot seem to find sufficient evidence to charge him. Guest starring Finlay Robertson (Life Begins), with Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part crime drama. Connor and Walker fear for the children's safety as their suspicions about Harwood are confirmed, and when they finally catch up with him it seems he has lost his mind. David Hayman, Victoria Smurfit and Charles Dance star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Romance blossoms between Lieutenant Kate Butler and an officer from another unit. Meanwhile, Glory is not on the cards for Luke Roberts.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Rumours start to circulate about Colonel Hammond's love life, and the fusiliers suspect his loyalties will be compromised by his new love.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An operation to detain an aggressive and armed senile pensioner goes horribly wrong and Amanda Prosser makes Gina the scapegoat, forcing the Borough Commander to suspend her from duty while her drink problem is assessed. Detectives Nixon and Nadir get a lead on big-time gangster Pete Larson, but Dale Smith can't resist playing with fire by wooing the villain's lonely wife.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The hospital staff have their work cut out after a car pile-up, giving Kyla the chance to earn some extra money to put toward her legal fight to keep Max. After their night of passion, Connie and Sam flirt with each other despite professional disagreements as they treat an injured couple, and Mark prepares to pop the question to Tricia.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Mikey and Josh lie buried under a pile of rubble following the landslide, Mel races against time to rescue them. Back at Holby, Charlie assembles a team in readiness for the expected influx of casualties - but Adam is nowhere to be found. Drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Kelsey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters is assigned to look after a recently released child-killer who has jeopardised her new identity by disclosing it to a former acquaintance. Roger gallantly offers to let penniless Russian prostitute Anka Markova stay with him, while Sheelagh is disturbed to learn assault victim Zoe Dowman won't make a statement because she's afraid of ex-boyfriend Gabriel Kent. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Ian and everyone are reeling from the shocking news of the death of Pete. Gita is convinced Michelle had an affair with her husband.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat decides to take matters into her own hands, and Frank is not pleased. Phil and Kathy agree to spend Christmas away together, but an unexpected visitor scuppers their plans.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The new Sub Officer arrives for her first shift at Blackwall, and realises she faces an uphill struggle to win the respect of the team.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul's desire to turn Glenbogle into a luxury retreat is severely tested when a very demanding Russian millionaire and his wife come to stay. Meanwhile, Ewan asks Donald for advice on ways to win Zoe back, but finds he may not be as interested in making amends as he thought. Highland drama, starring Lloyd Owen, Alexander Morton and Martin Compston.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A line-dancing champion whisks Anna off her feet and takes her out to dinner _ but the course of true love doesn't run smooth and she's soon pining to be rescued from the predicament. Beth is delighted to discover she's having a baby, but her joy is short-lived when it emerges the pregnancy is ectopic. Nathan is heartbroken when Candida reveals she plans to tour the world during her gap year and Rita confesses she suspects her husband Martin is having an affair. Kerrie Taylor, Lesley Dunlop and Josie Lawrence star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey argues with Darryl about the lack of trust in their relationship, and visits a therapist for advice on how to resolve the issue. Comedy, starring Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene eagerly anticipates Tyler's A-level results, dreaming of a long and distinguished academic future for her son. He is not as enamoured with the idea as she is, until Elgin, Jed, Bryan and Mrs Cakeworthy inadvertently paint a picture of the life he could have had. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: One of the Last Few Places Unexplored by Man
programme.desc: Compo wants his photo taken and decides Nora Batty's bedroom would provide the perfect backdrop. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Serenade for Tight Jeans and Metal Detector
programme.desc: Clegg buys a metal detector, so Foggy decides to show him how it works by searching for treasure on the Pennines. Meanwhile, Compo struggles with a new pair of jeans. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives. The mysterious death of a wealthy entrepreneur opens up a hornet's nest of family tensions, betrayal and cover-ups involving radioactive waste - and brings Dalziel face to face with an old flame. Cherie Lunghi guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: As the Gibraltar locals reel from the murder of shipping agent Gordon Fletcher, Brian and Gerry - last seen being carried off in a shipping container - find themselves stranded on the side of a Spanish mountain, and now face the problem of how to get back to the rest of the team. As Sandra attempts to unravel secrets stretching back over three decades and link what has now become three murders, she still has doubts about the innocence of charming entrepreneur Harry Truman - but that doesn't stop her joining him for lunch on his luxury yacht. Conclusion of a two-part story, with regulars Amanda Redman, Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson joined by Vincent Regan and George Irving.

programme.desc: The deaths of a local drug user and her infant child are disregarded by the police. Feature length episode of the forensic drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Busy observing the sky in search of UFOs, Magoo accidentally finds himself wandering over to Fizz's house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, hunting for Pinkbeard's treasure, mistakes the park for an island. Fizz and Weasel are there, selling ice cream that never falls on the ground..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo has decided to go mountain climbing but in reality, he is climbing up a skyscraper! He mixes Fizz up with a wounded bird and ruins his plan.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero sets out to replace his worn-out sofa, but finds he does not have enough cash for a new one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds a treasure map in a dusty corner of his attic, but the road to riches proves a rocky one.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Humungosaur! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Strange Strife of the Smelly Socktopus
programme.desc: The boys pull out all the stops to get themselves suspended when Erica describes it as a vacation..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James and fellow chef Mark Jordan discover the culinary delights of Guernsey. They sample local speciality Gache cake and a seafood platter fit for a king, while James uses the island's native dairy produce to make a creamy rice pudding with chargrilled peaches. The duo set themselves a fishing challenge by attempting to catch a mighty turbot, and James finishes the day by cooking a mouthwatering turbot dish.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Amman in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. He catches up with his old friend Maria who runs a cookery school, discovers how the country is becoming a serious wine-producing region and visits a bustling fruit and vegetable market for ingredients. Ainsley's dishes include chargrilled sumac lamb cutlets with tabbouleh and falafel with hummus.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: The duo are joined by Gordon and Tilly Ramsay, who prepare salmon en croute, and Juliet Sear, who makes thumbprint cookies. Plus, recipes for pull-apart bread stuffed with bacon and cheese, paella, patatas bravas, Greek salad, and strawberry pavlova.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: As summer begins, Delyth starts planning for the wedding season and the staff at Portmeirion celebrate the work of Susan Williams-Ellis - the pioneer behind its pottery. The programme also meets Rob Piercy, who has spent 25 years capturing the village on canvas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The owner of local country magazine Midsomer Life becomes a suspect when a man's body is discovered in woodland, and it is established the victim had been having an affair with his wife. As Barnaby and Jones delve into the case, another murder forces them to reassess their inquiries. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Simon Williams.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are at Wigan Athletic's DW Stadium, where Alys Dobbie is interested by a collection of cameras and Jon O'Marah finds out what a Corinthian aryballos is and Tony Geering assesses three 1966 World Cup trays.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, however, they have all used up their Golden Buzzers already - each granting a place in the live semi-finals to their chosen acts.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including a woman being kicked by a horse, a driver who tears off her car door and a teenager falling face first into manure.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Patels from Essex - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in this drama based on the novels of Georges Simenon. The summer of 1955 finds Paris in the grip of both sweltering heat and terror on the streets. Four women have been murdered in Montmartre, with no apparent connection between the victims. Chief Inspector Maigret comes under huge pressure from the public and his superiors to apprehend the killer before he can strike again. Fiona Shaw and Mark Heap head up the supporting cast.

programme.title: Mike Bassett: England Manager (2001)
programme.desc: An inept soccer coach is unexpectedly chosen as England's new manager. His dismal efforts see him go from national treasure to most hated man in England in record time - but the chance of redemption comes when a rules loophole puts his team in the running for the World Cup. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Amanda Redman, Philip Jackson, Bradley Walsh and Phill Jupitus.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small, while two celebrity teams go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Kent couple Lou and Andy Webb have two young children affected by a rare genetic condition that severely restricts their eyesight, meaning they only see in black and white and have to wear special goggles in sunlight. Alan Titchmarsh's challenge is to create a more child-friendly garden for their terraced home in Tonbridge, and his first task is to make a shady environment so the kids can spend time outside in the day. After that, he and the team come up with a bespoke lighting system for the evenings, acoustic fencing to cut down the noise from a nearby railway line, and an area for the parents.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp takes his team of ex-England players on a European tour, as they prepare for a rematch against theGerman Legends on their own soil. They begin in France at a self-catering hotel in the quiet medieval town of Provins, where Harrywants them to be on a detox and cook their own healthy food, but they don't even get through the first night without hitting the beers and ending up at the curry house.

programme.desc: Cameroon v England. Gabriel Clarke introduces highlights of the thrilling 1990 World Cup quarter-final from Stadio San Paolo in Naples, Italy. With original coverage hosted by Nick Owen and Elton Welsby and pre-match analysis from Bobby Moore and Jimmy Greaves.
